all_paragraphs: All you need is one line!

Python is a beginner-friendly language thanks to its easy syntax. Unlike other languages that require specific uses of curly brackets and semicolon, Python only cares about indentation. Up to this point, it has already seemed that Python cares for its users, isn’t it? However it doesn’t stop here, Python granted us even more convenience through its ability of writing one-liner code snippets. Though short, these one-line codes can be as powerful as a long and tedious program that is written in Python or any other languages.

By using Python one-liner, you will be able to code less and achieve more, which directly translates to the increase in productivity. Most importantly, one-liner codes are more fun to read and will showcase your proficiency in Python languages.

Learning this one-liners Python tricks will not make you a programming wiz. Nevertheless, it will be a fun thing to do and it will help you to become more productive (fewer lines of code → less time needed). Besides that, it will be cool to add these tricks in your code.
